Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2008 11:44AM califsun wrote: I had an MRI prior to my lumpectomy, it showed some other areas of concern so they did an mri guided byopsy because the areas didn't show up on the mamo or ultrasound, they found LCIS which is basically pre cancer cells. I went a head with the lumpectomy and SNB, no drains and felt good right a way, no pain pills after the 2nd day...and just a little sore in the arm pit area for a week or so. The MRI was very uncomfortable but doable...the first time I didn't take any meds, the second time I did, they gave me vicodin and it made it much easier...I highly recomend it. Good luck to you, Carol
Posts.Title: Drains & Time Off Work For Lumpectomy Kim32 Solihull

Posts.Content: Jul 24, 2008 11:25PM califsun wrote: The one thing I haven't seen any one mention that I wish I would have had was a back scratcher the first day and a half I couldn't even reach my face and you know when you can't reach an itch it's going to drive you crazy. I'll tell you when I got home I used my back scratcher every five minutes to reach places on my back, arms, legs and anywhere else I couldn't reach on my own. Also the first night I was really really thirsty, my dh was there to give me sips of water when I needed them but in the middle of the night I didn't want to wake him for that and I could'nt reach the water because the bed table was just a little too far away so when the nurse came in he moved the table and water cup within my reach which was a lifesaver...I felt like I was in the desert and I could see the water but I couldn't reach it...so those are the things I suggest
